page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY IN S. REIGATE
page.content: Sixteen acres at the top of Red - hill Common were to be used as a site for a military prison in 1862.The corner pillars can still be found.Ex- tensive quarrying of sand from Redhill Common had ceased by 1884 when the pleasure gardens off Mill Street were laid out.St John's church and school were built in 1843. The school clock spire was replaced by the present clock tower in 1910.The building at the corner of Mill Street and Brighton Road,Redhill was built in 1817 as a coaching inn and named the Summers Arms.Later it was used as the vicarage for St John's church and is currently flatted.The Market Laurie Day Centre in Church Road South Park was used for wounded soldiers during the first World War.
